summary: Enthusiastic, eager to learn, open to new experiences, with 5+ years experience in biotech and the clinical field. I am a hard worker with a particular love for history, science and traveling, with skills that can be used in various different fields of work.

projects.title: Mapping the Via Appia
projects.description: In July 2013 I participated in 'Mapping the Via Appia'; an NWO-supported archaeological project by the Radboud University Nijmegen, VU University Amsterdam, and the Royal Dutch Institute in Rome. The project investigates the fifth and sixth miles of the Via Appia.

company.name: Acerta Pharma B.V. (A member of the AstraZeneca Group)

profile_positions.company: Acerta Pharma B.V. (A member of the AstraZeneca Group)
profile_positions.title: Global Study Associate

profile_positions.description:
After four years as Project Manager I was given the opportunity to officially join Xenikos' Clinical Team and continue growing within the Clinical Operations field. 

As Clinical Trial Associate, I provide all kinds of support to Xenikos’ Clinical Operations – from developing story boards, maintaining and helping develop the eTMF, vendor management, tracking study-level progress, reviewing regulatory documents from sites, taking care of annual clinical administrative updates (e.g. with EMA and FDA) and providing overall clinical administrative support, to acting as the clinical operations central point of contact for delegated study communications, correspondence, and associated documentation.

GCP & GMP training completed.
profile_positions.title: Clinical Trial Associate

profile_positions.description:
My job as Project Manager at Xenikos had many aspects – from data management, processing patient files, editing, writing and translating both scientific and non-scientific documents, to overseeing the administration, finances and daily agenda, HR, organizing meetings, office management, and functioning as a contact person.

It allowed me to combine the research and processing skills of a historian with my background in science journalism and a personal interest in biology. It’s exciting to learn new things everyday and to be a part of the journey towards bringing T-Guard to the market.

During my time as Project Manager, I was also in training to become a Clinical Trial Associate (CTA), working directly with out CDO and CEO.

Xenikos is a Biotech company that aims to develop a new medicine, based on the action of antibodies, that enables patients suffering serious immune diseases or rejection after transplantation to reset their immune system quickly and efficiently.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description: Editing and writing articles, on voluntary basis.
profile_positions.title: Editor

profile_positions.description:
http://www.ru.nl/histnow/

History is alive! The HistNow project consisted of a platform (founded in december 2012 by historians of the Radboud University Nijmegen) that wants to show the ways in which people are a part of history, both as as individuals and as groups. Through columns, articles and social media we aim to highlight the connections between past and present. As editor I was responsible for writing and editing articles, helping to decide the directions in which the platform would be taken, and maintaining the facebook page.
profile_positions.title: Editor and social media

profile_positions.description: During my internship I worked as a fulltime editor and was able to have a lot of personal input. Activities consisted of: writing, translating and editing for magazine and website; research; collecting photographic material; participating in editorial meetings; contributing ideas; doing interviews; keeping contact with readers; maintaining the general e-mailaccount. I was able to work mostly independently, under the supervision of my supervisor.
profile_positions.title: Editorial intern

profile_positions.description: Reported on various activities throughout the country during the 2015 Romeinenweek (Roman week), for www.romeinenweek.nl. Amongst the activities were a Roman cooking workshop in Nijmegen, a visit to DOMunder in Utrecht, a boatride from Tolkamer to Nijmegen and a historical boatride in Woerden.
profile_positions.title: Reporter Romeinenweek 2015
